com.nus

Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nus.Quaternion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Quaternion
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Self-contained and lightweight Java implementation of Quaternion. The class supports a variety of Quaternion operations and functions
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isIdentity

        public boolean isIdentity()
        Checks if this Quaternion is an identity quaternion (0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0)
        Returns:
        true if this Quaternion is an identity quaternion, or false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Quaternion another,
                      double threshold)
        Checks if this Quaternion equals to the input Quaternion within the specified tolerance threshold
        Parameters:
        another - Another Quaternion for comparison
        threshold - A tolerance threshold value
        Returns:
        true if two Quaternions are equal within the tolerance threshold (that means corresponding components are equal within the tolerance threshold); false otherwise

      • exp

        public final Quaternion exp()
        Gets the exponential of this Quaternion
        Returns:
        The exponential Quaternion

      • log

        public final Quaternion log()
                     throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Gets the natural logarithm of this Quaternion
        Returns:
        The logarithm Quaternion
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the Quaternion has norm approaching 0, that is the norm is less than EPSILON

      • getRotationMatrix

        public final double[][] getRotationMatrix()
        Returns the rotation matrix represented by the normalized version of this quaternion
        Returns:
        A 3 x 3 rotation matrix

      • rotate

        public final double[] rotate(double[] vector)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Rotates a 3D vector by the rotation represented by this quaternion
        Parameters:
        vector - An array of size 3 representing a 3D vector
        Returns:
        The image of the input vector after the rotation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input vector is not an array of size 3

      • getIdentity

        public static Quaternion getIdentity()
        Gets an identity Quaternion (0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0)
        Returns:
        An identity Quaternion

      • fromAxisAngle

        public static Quaternion fromAxisAngle(double[] axis,
                                       double angleInDeg)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the unit Quaternion of a rotation which is given by the input axis, and angle (in degrees)
        Parameters:
        axis - An array of size 3 representing the vector (x, y, z)
        angleInDeg - The angle (in degrees) of the rotation
        Returns:
        The unit Quaternion of the rotation given by the input axis-angle representation. If the norm of input axis vector is less than EPSILON, an identity Quaternion is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input vector is not an array of size 3

      • fromAxisAngleRad

        public static Quaternion fromAxisAngleRad(double[] axis,
                                          double angleInRad)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the unit Quaternion of a rotation which is given by the input axis, and angle (in radians)
        Parameters:
        axis - An array of size 3 representing the vector (x, y, z)
        angleInRad - The angle (in radians) of the rotation
        Returns:
        The unit Quaternion of the rotation given by the input axis-angle representation. If the norm of input axis vector is less than EPSILON, an identity Quaternion is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input vector is not an array of size 3

      • fromEulerAngles

        public static Quaternion fromEulerAngles(double roll,
                                         double pitch,
                                         double yaw)
        Gets the unit Quaternion of a rotation specified by Euler . The order of rotation is applying yaw, then pitch, then roll (that is z -> y -> x)
        Parameters:
        roll - The roll angle (in radians)
        pitch - The pitch angle (in radians)
        yaw - The yaw angle (in radians)
        Returns:
        The unit Quaternion of a rotation specified by roll, pitch, yaw angles

      • lerp

        public static Quaternion lerp(Quaternion from,
                              Quaternion to,
                              double t)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Interpolates linearly between from and to Quaternion. When t = 1, the to Quaternion is returned. When t = 0, the from Quaternion is returned
        Parameters:
        from - The first Quaternion
        to - The second Quaternion
        t - Value indicating how far to interpolate between the two Quaternions
        Returns:
        The resulting Quaternion for linear interpolation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if t is not between 0 and 1 inclusively

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a string representation of this Quaternion for display purposes
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string contains information about this Quaternion
